zRBRXSjPIxtmRkFZOaU3vw.text: Absolutely phenomenal. Hands down some of the best Indian food my wife and I have ever had in our lives. We went in London and loved it so much that we had it again in Edinburgh. The view in Edinburgh is much better and the lines are shorter. Highly recommended!

rTbf6pn2Pi_GiIUa4jAbBw.text: This is by far the best meal I have had in years! Not to mention incredible drinks and incredible service.  Every dish I tried was remarkable, so much so that I was happy to wait for a table to open the following night so that I could try a whole new set of dishes and drinks, which once again, were fabulous! On top of it all, our waitress Niki, was MORE then fantastic.. she provided my travel mates and I different spots we would should check out around Scotland on our travels and we had an incredible time.. my recommendations... don't think.. just go... I don't care if you have to wait an hour to get seated.. just go downstairs to the bar and have fabulous drinks...try the chicken ruby and chocolate pudding... and feel transported to Bombay! Thanks so much Niki!

IZOUmWFj0mQ5buT5-LIDEg.text: Great service.  We went on a Saturday and had to wait in a 20 minute line before going to the bar for another 20 minutes.  We were provided refreshments in the line and the bar had comfortable seating where you could wait.  After getting to our table, the food came out ridiculously fast & was delicious.  This is a good place to share dishes.  On the pricier side for the younger crowd so it keeps out teenage tourists and brings in the Edinburgh crowd.

X7vWFhUT8jOwH9PBYQb52A.text: Entire vegan menu, just ask or look on the website! Bedmi puri option was excellent for those who like spice

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Okra fry
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan options for gunpowder potatoes, bowl of greens, pomelo salad, kachumber
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan option for bedmi puri

UlQgGMFfjlt-W5fOBEDM7w.text: I would give this restaurant 10 stars if I could! I visited during their 'soft launch' which gave us 50% of ALL FOOD AND DRINK - no exceptions. We went on a busy Saturday night and had to queue outside for a while, it wasn't too cold and the atmosphere was friendly so it wasn't as bad as it sounds. The hostesses also came round with little glasses of sherry and chai tea to keep us going.   Once we got inside we were told to make our way downstairs to The Permit Room where we could have a few drinks while we waited on our table. When we got downstairs we felt we had been transported back in time to 1950s India, the decor and atmosphere was amazing. We were greeted again by a host who told us that because of the waiting times our first drink was on the house - result! I had the Pila House Sling and my boyfriend had Viceroy's Old Fashioned. The cocktails have very different flavours to traditional ones but they're delicious.   When our table was finally ready, we travelled up in a little lift to the top floor where the restaurant was located. Again, the decor was very traditional and the whole room was alive with people chatting and eating - a great Saturday night buzz! The menu is kind of like tapas so we choose a few dishes to share between us. We opted for the lamb samosas, keema pau, calamari, chicken tikka and lamb biryani. Everything was delicious but the calamari was the standout for me and one I would definitely order again.   Overall, this restaurant is quite different to typical Indian food you would get in Edinburgh. The cocktails, food and service is exceptional and even though we got 50% off the bill the full price menu is still reasonable. Would definitely recommend.

cUqkPWmz5R3SobaFA2aaWg.text: They make you wait in order to buy drinks even when it's not that busy. They told us it may be an hour or hour and a half but "probably much sooner so go downstairs and get yourself a drink ". One and a half hours later, we were still waiting on a table. Drinks were weak and alcohol poured stingily (word?). It just wasn't that busy to justify the wait. 2 tables on either side of use were empty when we were seated. See pics. Service was slow and badly timed. Food was spicy as expected and generally good but overly salted. Had to ask for dessert menus several times. Prices were reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1Wu3uE61j833s9aOvC8UYg.text: The food was really delicious and the service was quick. We were there on a tuesday night and as you can't reserve a table, we waited for around 45 minutes to be seated. This can prove to be a bit of a downside if you are really hungry.

0KIk09uvtX02WjuQNFMhuQ.text: Food was solid, ambiance amazing (very classic '20s look), and service exceeded even NYC standards.   Try the cheese naan, black daal, and calamari for sure.

nyWDVBlxcFC8RL_f-X2rYA.text: I went there for breakfast this morning before heading to airport, having just enough time to comfrtly enjoy the most important meal of the day.  Unfortunately, after waiting for 15 minutes and nobody even showing up to inform that they are very busy (not exactly the case), I decided to leave and have my breakfast at the airport.  The place seamed to have a good atmosphere and an interesting breakfast menu with naan sausage rolls and other goodies. But bad service at the wrong time didn't let me experience it first hand.

bTcNz_bKEBWTDcT5sWfSAQ.text: Ask your self what you want out of a restaurant. 1 Friendly service. 2 helpful service. 3 food brought to your table quick. 4 food to taste good. Well today I got all 4, been to the one in Covent Garden and the food was just as good but here in Edinburgh the friendliness of the staff is probably the best I have had in any restaurant anyway. Food was outstanding. Staff outstanding.. the manger took time out to have a chat and recommended what dips to use with the foods, the young girl serving was very helpful and honest, best restaurant experience in the city of Edinburgh over the last 3 days. Can be hard to get a table so try pre book. Food is authentic and amazing..

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jtd5JBXI0MW83kji_23LWg.text: It was delicious, little spicy for kids but lots of options for kids too. I had dinner and breakfast here. Wish I had 5 breakfast meals here. Try the chocolate chai!

wXArYd5bB8_Sr4mQVZJlHQ.text: Lovely restaurant, great Ruby chicken curry. Our naam ans rasta was also excellent. The staff is very friendly and fast. Reservations are probably recommended on more crowded evenings. They offer tap water which I also always like.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious dinner @ Dishoom

FXY4WZGOeZb-ARoa_ZWwfQ.text: Fantastic food and excellent service.  You can't go wrong !  Great location.  If you can't make up your mind they will give suggestions but really don't think you can wrong with anything !  They even proactively ask about food allergies.  Nice touch !

CH5YY0TVRIWZtsVxG5oSmg.text: Gorgeous atmosphere. Gourmet food. Friendliest staff. Best paneer tikka I've ever had!!cant wait to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

vVgvYHHFcu6ZBAww7nYo_A.text: Amazing... amazing... amazing! This place is great.if you're coming around 6 to 8 expect a wait, go down stairs for drinks. My friends and I can't stop talking about our dinner, best Indian food we've had so far.

iUgFU93c1dxs_9GZNGClYA.text: I have been to Dishoom twice.  Both visits were wonderful. All the dishes are quite unique.  The Waitrose told us the food was more Persian than Indian.  The flavours were just delicious.  The service is great,  lovely atmosphere too. Only drawback is no reservations for parties less than 6.

7AbWhJ7qr9B_MIwUEprsow.text: I tried Dishoom for the first time on a visit to London and was excited to find out that they were opening a restaurant in Edinburgh!   With the 50% off pricing for the soft open, my friends and I have been able to sample a bunch of different dishes - everything was awesome. Highlights include the black house daal, mattar paneer, and the chole bhatura.   Shout out to Abdul for being an awesome waiter and recommending breakfast. He was the real MVP.

JBe4g6ELSk-I_MguQgQZNw.text: Dishoom never disappoints! Although I have been to the Shoreditch Dishoom a few times, this was my first time at the Edinburgh location. I was with a friend and, between us, we had the vegetable samosos, firecracker potatoes, a prawn dish, and two chicken dishes. The serving sizes are tapas style, and we might have overdone it just a little, but everything was really good! The restaurant was out of wheat beer, which was disappointing, but no other hiccups besides that. I highly recommend this Dishoom location!

xQbG01kPSQiKZ0mRpHF8Dw.text: Really great food, good value and very cool ambiance.

hGyBheX_5jQtpx646bczBA.text: Easily my favorite Indian restaurant outside of India. Delicious food, warm hospitality, kid friendly and a variety of vegetarian options for our vegetarian group. One of the kids in our group had a certain food allergy, the server took care of it so well, we were impressed. All in all, 5 stars from me.

KiPIaR99q8Vc820GDLjUAQ.text: Dishoom is a great spot for food whether you're going on a date, or a large group of people.   I've ordered almost everything on the menu here and I can't say I have ever been even slightly disappointed. It's all small plates and you can really not go wrong, but the gunpowder potatoes, bowl of mixed greens, black dahl, and the shrimp/calamari are my favorites.   Make sure you also order something saucy, but the fantastic staff will be great about getting you familiar with the menu also.

ybdGlLaMPbnqiHccMnuB7Q.text: This restaurant came highly recommended from a few friends who had just came back from holiday in Edinburgh and frequented it multiple times.  I was nervous as I was traveling solo and had been warned they don't take reservations.  The bar is downstairs and is primarily reserved from those parties waiting for a table so I knew this wouldn't be an option.  I arrived at quarter past eight, and was easily sat at the breakfast bar on the main level.  While I missed out on the atmosphere, I was able to people watch the pedestrians walking by and was happy to try the food.  I took the waiter's recommendation - and started with the calamari and naan and I was happy I did.  Both were excellent, and I know that is odd to describe naan as excellent, but the flavors were great!!  I then had the chef's special "Sale Boti."  I was hungry so I did the whole and was happy I did.  While I am not a spicy girl, the spices definitely created some sweat pebbles on my forehead and I didn't mind!  I end with a chai.. You must end with a chai....  I took the train to London for a weekend of theater and while there a friend asked if I wanted Indian, as he knew the best place in town.  I giggled to myself and said "Dishoom?"  Of course, I was right!!

aFLAPY21PXW7tsLGZvFCJA.text: Just amazing!!!! Best Indian Food I've EVER had! Do yourself a favor and eat here. You just have to!!!! You need it, gotta have it, and it'll change your life! Everyone is soooo nice here amazing service and all the employees just look so happy here.

un4FLHExm_fzqfNdS6eaJA.text: Some of the best Indian food I've had. It comes on small plates so you try different things. They had a pretty extensive gluten-free menu and the waiter was also able to tell me which things on the regular menu only had a little gluten. I had spicy shrimp, paneer tikka, and mixed greens, and loved every bite. Great vibe, and friendly staff. A little loud but I was by myself so I didn't mind.

4OUwwFIlLIwHoW-ZMZROtA.text: Extremely good food and very friendly staff. We had to wait about 40 min for our table but we spent that time in the bar, which had delicious cocktails. From the bar we went to our table and we were greeted by our excellent server Nikki. She was honest friendly and really knew her stuff - how much food was too much food, and what would accompany what. She even gave us helpful tips for our trip to Paris! The food, when it came out, was the best Indian food I've had and that includes what can be found in the States. I recommend the Murgh Malai!

4gSfljDhLERYQ2UegzfX8A.text: Such a wonderful experience for my first time at Dishoom! The waiter was very knowledgeable despite not being Indian. The food was delicious. The biggest bonus for me - they were incredibly allergy friendly! My son has multiple food allergies. The waiter made note of everything and brought the menu back to the chefs. The chefs circled everything on the menu that was allergy friendly and everything they could make allergy friendly! For example, mango lassi is always with dairy yogurt. They made it for my son with coconut yogurt instead, and they even said it was a first time making it like that but they were happy to try out something new. No wonder no reservations are ever available unless you go for lunch, and there's a line out the door for dinner!

DOTky6D8oX-4Hhep-U5nbQ.text: Simply some of the best Indian food I have ever eaten. Wonderful flavor. Great beers. Excellent service.

gX1olwqh6qs4WshLQWlofA.text: On a recent visit to Edinburgh, I heard that one of my favorite Indian places from London has now a branch here too. It is an Iranian cafe from Mumbai, India. I knew I had to try it. It is in St. Andrews Square overlooking the park - lovely location and is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. There are so many items on the menu that everyone can find something to their liking no matter what time of the day. The entrance has a Ganesh statue welcoming you. They do not take reservations for parties under six and have bar seating on the 1st floor level as well as an upstairs room and seating in the basement too. I ate upstairs which with its huge windows has plenty of light   filtering in, has a bar area and plenty of seating available. It was loud and vibrant inside as the place was very busy but wasn't disturbing at all. The furniture has the aged and antique look which contrasts well with some modern decorations - giving it a very warm and inviting look. The walls are covered with photos of owner's ancestors - mostly in black and white and several sayings in Hindi - very interesting decor. The food is delicious, cooked to perfection with the right amount of spice. Tried several dishes starting with the okra fries, ruby chicken, garlic naan and their special on their menu - sali boti. Ruby chicken is like spicy butter chicken - was so soft and perfectly cooked.  Sali boti was lamb curry topped with crunchy potato sticks and was served with roomali roti - had option of half or full plate. Lamb is not easy to cook - compared to many other good places this one is by far one of the best I've tasted. They served the food with a trio condiment consisting of mint, sweet tamarind and spicy sauce. For desserts, we tried their malai kulfi which was served on sticks and their chocolate pudding which comes with spicy ice cream. They give you a choice of cinnamon ice cream too. Food was very authentic and service was great. It was served quickly as well. Ultimately, it's the food quality, presentation and experience which makes the restaurant stand out and this one meets on all counts.  A must visit and highly recommended - 5 stars on all counts.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dishoom currency
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

NhTXMNDTjcA9F_oWP1VnsA.text: My wife and I ate here 5 time on our 4 day trip to Edinburgh.  It was our daily stop for breakfast as it was near the hotel and opened at 8 am most days.    The Bombay Omelet at Dishoom transports my wife back home when her grandmother made Sunday omelettes with the same spices and ingredients.  The Breakfast Naan Rolls are really big for the price.  I recommend going for the bottomless chai tea.  Breakfast is pretty reasonably priced at less than 20 pounds for 2 people including tea.    You really need reservations for dinner here as it gets busy at night.

CWTQHYS6iRQgxSC652owWQ.text: OMG THIS PLACE. I am obsessed. Gorgeous restaurant, unbelievably delicious food, fabulous servers, sexy speakeasy-feel bar downstairs. Love it love it. Try the okra fries, black daal, calamari, and much more!

gSBxXvC3M12tZE3s3qTPrg.text: A great dining experience and a unique cocktail menu. I tasted a few different cocktails for the menu, but the hoppy butter beer things was something special and dangerously smooth, sweet and drinkable. The foods menu has great options. Of seven dishes we ordered, six were excellent and one was just ok and that would be the shrimp dish. The spicy dishes were just about right and not off the charts hot.

HwCegYISLlpxKthfa8DtOA.text: Excellent modern take on traditional Indian fare.  Great atmosphere and entertaining staff.  The Dal was my favorite dish but also enjoyed the Chicken Ruby (their take in CTM) and the Paneer Tikka.

QBEHBs_BCJWCGKhd8Fdy0g.text: GREAT Indian food. When we arrived at ~6:30pm, there was already a line out the door, which the waiter told us would be approximately a 45 minute wait. (We tried making a reservation for a group of 4, but reservations are only available to groups of 6+.) The wait outside passed by pretty quickly - a waiter even brought us hot tea twice! After we made it in, we were given a buzzer to wait in the bar area, and were given a table in the bar area in 10 or so minutes. We had enough time to finish one drink before being seated. I got the virgin colada which was just the right amount of sweet and came with coconut flakes.   As for the actual meal, my table ordered veggie samosas, two servings of garlic naan with butter, Awadhi lamb biryani, chicken ruby, and a half plate of the chef's special (spicy lamb and fried naan). The food was AMAZING. However, the servings were smaller than expected, so we ended up SCRAPING our plates clean. This last morsel of unsatisfied hunger is the only reason to my missing final star - otherwise, truly a stellar dining experience even with the wait.

cYaq7XitcJXQy3DM37KUnQ.text: The food was really good. We really liked the concept of smaller dishes to share. The food isn't what you'd find in your local Indian (Bangladeshi) restaurant- there's no tikka masala or korma, this is the kind of street food you'd find on the streets of India.  The black daal was lovely, a perfect balance of spice & flavour. The chicken thighs & fish from the grill were tender & had a lovely flavour.  Despite being busy the service was attentive & professional. The spiced chai cider is worth a try if you fancy something other than beer

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chai spiced cider chai-der

ZSH2VGuMEdZlbq1eEptdFw.text: Our favorite restaurant in the city. No matter what, we always get the okra fries and the house black daal. The naan and roti are done perfectly, and all the curries are legit.  This is the only restaurant in the whole city where people actually queue to eat there.  I wouldn't say this place is a traditional Indian restaurant, especially considering the price, but it's still delicious.  The only thing we weren't huge fans of was the grilled lamb kebab. Didn't have much flavor and was a little dry. But everything else we've had was excellent, and the service is always top notch and incredibly friendly.

fBwU7DcU_cSXh36hhdaBOA.text: So I was strolling on a cold evening on streets of Edinburgh, starving and looking for any good restaurants and I stumbled on Dishoom. I did not have a reservation so the hostess said it was a 30 minute wait. However, the patio seating had no wait. I jumped on that opportunity and happily took the patio seat with the hope that it won't rain. The hostess offered me a hot tea to keep me warm and it was refreshing to have that kind of politeness and warmth in terms of customer service in UK. Shortly, a spot at the bar inside opened up and she helped me move there. I went for a simple food in terms of my order and got the daal, rice and fried okhra. The fried okra was amazing and really completed my meal with the dal rice. The daal was rich and slightly tangy. They kept checking on me regularly during the meal and made sure I was comfortable ( I had lots of bags with me and I was trying to place them safely). I would like to definitely come back and have other dishes...if only I lived in Edinburgh !

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Naughty

j1YpH0anAiNnsoSfA8AnMA.text: Quite possibly the best Indian food I have ever eaten.  Make sure to get the chicken ruby and black daal.  The samosas are excellent and not at all greasy.  Also, the calamari are fantastic.  For an alcoholic beverage, try the bellini-so yummy!

shVMuHHj-t38_JxZDDw1Ig.text: Came in on a nice afternoon and git a great seat facing the St. Andrews square. Excellent garlic nan and dal. Loved the chutneys and ending with great filter coffee.  The ambience is very Irani style with great attention to detail that we loved. The service was top notch.   Highly recommend this one !

8nPStAp1UC1zpAaTbIpV6g.text: Bustling, relaxed atmosphere.  Good background tunes and lovely sweet smelling incense complements the dark eastern interior. Food was good: we had the calamari, sali boti, dahl, naan and ruby chicken. All were lovely but the boti was a bit salted for me. When we saw the portions arriving we thought we had been short changed but it turned out that there was more food than we could manage! The cocktails were gorgeous (highly recommend the Colaba Colada!) and the mango kulfi was like a yummy frozen mango lassi.  I'm looking forward for going to back to try the rest of the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

__CCYGpj8oqcgs9fXpkthw.text: Excellent customer service - looking after us with complimentary drinks as our table wasn't ready per booking and wonderfully a  surprise bottle of fizz to celebrate the birthdays.   Food as always delicious

R9KuPUVrxk0UXCzS57B4OQ.text: Extraordinary: amazing service, excellent food, tasty creative cocktails with a lot of equally good non-alcoholic options, some really solid chai, and a nice vibe and story.

-ban7H4HrTMDNchCRwTJeQ.text: Came here for Sunday lunch, and got in right away with no wait. Good ambience and great service  It's overall 4.5* place than a 5, for the price and taste. Also note that this place isn't spicy AT ALL for my Indian taste buds. Keep that in mind when ordering  We were a group of four, and ordered bunch of things in menu  Egg naan roll: 4/5. Naan's bit thick and chewy for a roll. But once you reach the stuffing it tasted pretty good. But on sweeter side though  Okra fries:4.5/5. Almost perfect except for the fat which were less crispy inside  Kheema pav: 5/5. Favorite dish of the day. Kheema was great and the bun was nice and soft  Mango lassi: 5/5. Not too sweet and not too cold. Just perfect  Chai paanch: 5/5. A scotch cocktail with chai flavor. That's 2 drinks I like in one :) It was smooth and bit sweet  Lamb biryani: 4/5. I'm a Hyderabadi, and I'm particular about my biryani. Wasn't as favorful as I would like  Black dal with roomali roti: 3.5/5. I liked their dal when I tried it in London, but not much this time here. It was too creamy for a dal.  Malai kulfi: 5/5. Very sweet. And tasted like back home

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chai paanch, on arrival
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Finishing touch. Chai paanch

PKX-DBp140pPBcj7UI7x3g.text: Truly lovely food, service (our waitress assisted us in choosing a good mix!), and ambience. We highly recommend.

FMMT_y6UT9NTFN_AD-OtpQ.text: I don't usually take the time to write a review, but feel that I have to comment on the amazing experiences I have had at Dishoom.    Whenever in Edinburgh, I make a point of taking work colleagues so they can experience first hand.  Through our visits, we have tried nearly every item on the menu, and have loved every one.    Even though you may have to wait a small amount of time for your table, the pre-dinner drinks in the Permit room are a great part of the experience.    If you are in Edinburgh, make a point of stopping at Dishoom!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

ATPL1ulee4CRQdCpAb4k3g.text: Really good place to eat Mumbai style food. Good flavours on all their dishes. Tried the Bhel, vada pav, pav bhaji, chicken roll, panneer roll and few drinks. All were good and in Edinburgh. Was surprised to see jackfruit biryani on the menu. Would like to try it next time.

33X_eI6znxMsZMsxsWBRNw.text: What an incredible spot. I wouldn't be lying if I said that this was the best Indian food I've had outside India. The bar had great drinks as we waited to get seated. Service was quick, friendly and very attentive. The food was served in traditional Indian "thalis" and stainless steel glasses. All in all, the this busy restaurant captured the chaos of India (in a good way), and at the same time recreated the magic that Indian food can be!

SOldGrDWVjiRg5ZQdRyQFg.text: First meal in Scotland and I was beyond impressed. We noticed the great reviews for Dishoom in London, but unfortunately did not have time to fit a meal there into our schedule. Luckily, we perused Yelp Scotland and saw one a short walk from our hotel. YES.   We arrived around 7:00 p.m. and were quoted a 70 minute wait for a party of 2. No biggie, because there is an amazing bar downstairs to hang out at while waiting for a table. The downstairs bar smelled of incense and had a great selection of cocktails and bar snacks that transfer to your table tab. The Chaijito (think Indian mojito) and Mulled Bramble hit the spot. The potato crisps were great to munch on while waiting. Fortunately, we only waited about 30 minutes before being seated.   The food was absolutely delicious! Some of the best Indian I've ever had. The vegetable samosas were piping hot and generously filled with peas, carrots, and potatoes. I highly recommend the Black Daal-- so flavorful! The Raita and Garlic Naan helped to cool off the spicy daal and Chicken Tikka.   The service and ambiance were also great. I highly recommend Dishoom and would love to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Viceroy Old Fashioned
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chaijito
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegetable Samosas

1fXvpohugD6TLjuSoqurfg.text: We tried walking up one night during prime dinner time and we were told it was an hour wait, understandable, so we came back the next day for a late lunch/early dinner and were seated right away (2 people). The food is sort of tapas style we ordered 5 things to share and it was perfect. The team of servers were all so nice and helpful when ordering and service was fast. I ordered a watermelon-mint sort of drink (can't recall the name) and it was so refreshing and amazing. Food is great and filling and the vibe here is really cool!

mXlSOLUUAecyRcAqpvj7Jg.text: Absolutely excellent from the food to the service to the ambience and it is very affordable.  If you love great Indian food and are In Edinburgh, don't pass up this place. You will not be disappointed.

8WI3l1-P_4pFoqegEoHyZA.text: Breakfast of champions .. wow !! Totally worth it. This place was spoken about since we left the US and the taste was exceptional! I think the plan is to come back for lunch and experience their lunch !!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

0iMckoo785RgwlZpdRHtMw.text: Dishoom is absolutely fantastic!  The food and the service are not to be missed.  There is a wait in the afternoons so make a reservation if you cannot come earlier.  I was in Edinburgh twice in one week and both times I went to Dishoom because it was so good.   Fried Green Chilies...if you like spicy, these are delicious.  Lightly breaded and fried to perfection.  Chole Puri, (Fried Puris puffed with spiced Chickpeas).  Spicy and savory.   A wonderful dish.  Chicken Ruby.  It's Chicken Tikka Masala.  Very delicious.  Garlic Naan.  House Black Daal.  Dishoom's signature dish.  These are Lentils slowly cooked in a mixture of spices.  They are fantastic.  We spent a little bit of time in the Bar downstairs waiting for a table on my second visit.  It is a nice set up and a great place to spend time while you wait for your table.  If you like Indian, don't miss Dishoom!

CVI0-XU_l1P9urIPlJWQdw.text: SO SO GOOD!!  I was sad I couldn't go to Dishoom in London (the line for dinner was too long and they didn't take reservations). So, when I arrived in Edinburgh by bus around 7am, I waited until Dishoom opened at 8am to grab breakfast, and it was so worth.  I ordered the Bacon Naan Roll and loved it. I didn't expect this combination of ingredients would go so well together.  Dishoom's House Chai is also a must! You also get free refills!! I noticed a few locals who brought there work with them so they could enjoy the Chai at Dishoom, and I would too if I lived in Edinburgh.  I really can't think of anything I didn't like about Dishoom. The food was amazing and very affordable. The service was great. And I loved the interior. I hope to return to a Dishoom soon and try other items on their menu.  --  taste / 5 aesthetics / 5 vibe / 5 service / 5 price for quality / 5 OVERALL / 5

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. second floor
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Bacon Naan Roll

t2AcozmlJo766qPyrWXGUg.text: I've heard so many wonderful things about Dishoom, both in Edinburgh and London that I was absolutely dying to try this place out! I was not disappointed in the food at all! It was very rich and hearty and does not feel like a commercialized attempt at authentic Indian cuisine - although there are quite a few "modern" twist to Indian dishes. I decided to stick to what I knew I could judge and ordered the chicken tikka, the chicken ruby (basically chicken tikka masala) with regular naan. There was a seasonal side dish of a small lamb chop that I ordered as well. The food was incredible fresh and delicious, however the food is quite overpriced given the restaurant's location and popularity. The waiter said the entrees were meant to be shared and that is why it was a little pricier, however it was only the right amount of food for just one person. The 3 chutneys were so flavorful and one quite spicy, it really elevated the taste of all of the food. Overall the restaurant has a great ambiance but be prepared to wait in line outside if you go during peak hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lamb chop, Chicken Ruby (chicken tikka masala), chicken tikka, salad, regular naan

74XEecNxyxOID3cwlukiGw.text: When the Chicken Baryani is served in a pot with flour pasted on its rim to ensure the flavors are continuously cooked by the trapped steam, just the way Baryani is supposed to be cooked, then it's clear that the establishment isn't playing around with authenticity of its food.  From the moment you walk in you are made aware of the class and style Dishoom has to offer. Very professional yet nice staff. The bartenders that made our drinks while we waited for our table were both very sweet and creative. Though it was extremely busy but still they carefully listened to what we would like to drink and crafted the drinks perfectly to our tastes.  It's a fusion restaurant and that's made very clear in every aspect of Dishoom. From the decor to cocktails to table ware and serving dishes, everything is clearly chosen to reflect traditional Mumbai Indian culture yet mixed beautifully with contemporary style.  Food recommendations; Chicken Baryani, Chicken ruby, and don't miss out the amazingly scrumptious Kali/Black daal.  Of course the meal wasn't complete without the delicious malai kulfi and chai.  They don't accept reservations but it's completely worth the wait.  Really wish they opened a branch here is US.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

BP1qYc_8J31GB1xsHkR8YQ.text: We were just walking around Edinburgh, looking for a place to eat, and had no big plans.  We happened upon Dishoom and from the moment we walked in the door, knew we were in for a great meal.  Dishoom is a bit trendy Indian style food, and served as one would receive street food in India.  There was no place for waiting so the staff asked us if we would like to wait in the bar.  Of course we would!  We waited some time, which I forgot about because the drinks and appetizers at the bar had me completely distracted.  Also, they had toys for kids, which kept me and the little girl occupied and lost in fun.  Who can resist Etch a Sketch?  I must admit it is seldom that I lose track of time while waiting in a restaurant, but Dishoom got me!    All too soon the server came to collect us and get us all sorted out.  We went up to the restaurant and boy did we have a great meal! I mean it was indescribable how the flavors burst forth in my mouth! Bite after bite and dish after dish I was happily shocked! I didn't know Indian food could be this amazing, and I really love Indian food.    Some people said it is actually Iranian food, from Mumbai, or maybe it is a fusion, in any event, it is fantastic!  For us, there will be another trip to Scotland, and therefore certainly another trip to Dishoom!  It is a repeat for certain.  I can't recommend it highly enough.

24eGT28j7cA921ExyIjEGA.text: Great lunch!!  Had the grilled calamari; so different! Was a bit sweet.  Had the chooli. Amazing! Puffy bread with chick peas.  Also had the Edinburg special which is braised lamb with roti. Was excellent, a bit spicy, but they put tiny fried chips on top which get soggy after some time, but still good.   Good breakfasts with an Indian twist.  Had the spicy chicken liver dish. Was good! Also had the big Bombay, basically an Indianized English breakfast. Normal sausage and bacon. Masala beans and the eggs were good. Overall it was OK but I would have chosen something else to try something different.    They put coriander on everything which was great if you like coriander.

sUW2uhekeQBcCqX2IUU3Bg.text: Ruby chicken is some of the best butter chicken I have ever eaten!  Delightful!  Totally lived up to the hype. 10/10 would return!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

3fzs9lE00hg7tzMSA7Zonw.text: We had an hour wait to get in (went to the bar in the basement). They said an hour - was probably closer to 30 min - but so worth the wait!!  I am a huge fan of Indian food. I've had the opportunity to eat it world wide. I must say, this is legit one of the best I have ever eaten at. It's not traditional but it's not modernized too much to take away what makes Indian food a phenomenal cuisine.   Portion sizes were bang on. We had a large group and therefore a ton of different dishes. All were excellent.   The garlic naan - don't miss it!

uqfSVLUdPO_pGHKrSUDvhA.text: This was one of our favorite meals on our entire trip. We went for breakfast on a rainy morning and both had the naan breakfast sandwiches. What an amazing twist on a breakfast sandwich. The chai was phenomenal. I have a food allergy and the waiter went above and beyond when I told him. I know that Indian food has a lot of onion in it but he took a menu to the kitchen and confirmed what options I had that could be made without onions. This was my first experience with this level of service and hospitality. If you're ever in Edinburgh- this place is worth going out of your way for!

uaePUYiXs6mB-v4fb0ix2Q.text: Very good food, nice ambiance, and easy enough to get a table on a weeknight.  Most memorable dish was probably the okra fries, how do they get that texture? Crispy outside and tender inside with excellent flavour. House black daal was okay but not that memorable. Chicken ruby was delicious, and texture was good on the chicken. The Edinburgh chef's special was also very good and roti was thin and buttery (or greasy depending on how you look at it).  Would definitely come back or check out their other locations!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. chutneys
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. okra fries, house daal, chicken ruby, chef&#39;s edinburgh special braised lamb (sali boti) with roti and basmati rice

g4P_YY52j6Z_npS9EfsIUw.text: My partner and I ate at Dishoom yesterday evening; we shared multiple lamb dishes. Shortly after our meal, I began to experience stomach pains, nausea, and vomiting; my partner believes it is food poisoning as he too is experiencing said symptoms. This is my first food poisoning event which sadly, has occurred while vacationing in the United Kingdom. I rate Dishoom 0/5 stars. Thanks for the memories.

n60Yr4GHW7muPk1vkiVe4Q.text: Best Indian food I've ever had! We ordered a few items from the menu and all were really good. Portions are on the smaller size. It's best to get a few and share. Ask their recommendation, we did and we're so impressed. Everything was delicious. Sorry, there was no time to take pictures.

enXTN80uPp2jnK5Q_RoMQA.text: Came here for breakfast on a whim. Best idea ever! The food is absolutely delicious. The restaurant is beautifully decorated with a really lovely atmosphere. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. We had a great spot with a view of St. Andrews Square. I don't know if we'll be able to come back here again before we leave the city, but I'll be thinking of this place for long after our vacation has ended.

nky3YuCWw1BTSg3CQviL8g.text: Heard great things about Dishoom. We fly all the way from NY to try this place. Saturday night reservations were made months before arriving. We ended up making Sunday night reservations as we finished Saturday night dinner. Needless to say, definitely worth the trip. An absolute gem!!!!  Fingers crossed Dishoom decides to make a trip across the pond and call NY home!!!!  We definitely loved everything we had.

sa24pLX2jDCAr1zEKKjN2A.text: Always an excellent choice for lunch (our faves are the berry biryani and chicken ruby) or for breakfast (our faves are the Parsi omelette, kejriwal, and the akuri). The lassis are refreshing and the bottomless chai will fortify you all day.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Kejriwal
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Parsi omelette
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Akuri

E91lpTjoJ7OMPyUaC5qBrg.text: Amazing!  I was thrilled to discover that Dishoom had a branch in Edinburgh!  I am embarrassed to say I loved the food so much I ate here twice during my visit!  First, I should say I am not a fan of Indian food.  I took a chance upon a suggestion from a trusted friend that the food here was amazing, and it turned out to be True.    Dishes I had included the Vegetable Samosas, Keema Pau, Murgh Malai, Chicken Ruby, Bowl Of Greens, and the Gulab Jamun for dessert.   The star of the meal was the Chicken Ruby, WOW.  I pretty much licked the bowl it was so good.  Of the starters I preferred the Keema Pau over the Vegetable Samosas mostly because I prefer non-dough sort of foods.    While I loved the mains and starters, the dessert selection (i.e. puddings) wasn't really for me. The one I did try (Gulab Jamun) was very well made, I just didn't care for it but it did have good quality ingredients like all the other dishes.   The prices are reasonable, the food is great. Don't hesitate to give this a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gulab Jamun
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Keema Pau
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Ruby!!! Delicious!! Just get this don&#39;t hesitate at all

gi7uJiaRmPj7rMUynksgfg.text: Came here twice for dinner on a recent trip to Edinburgh, and really love the food and especially the atmosphere. Everything we had was solid, some more memorable than others, and the service was very lovely and attentive. Over our two meals we tried:   Chicken biryani (this was the absolute best - we got it both nights and basically came back for this) Chicken Ruby (delicious, and tender) Sali Boti (half plate) (very good! Half plate was enough for trying it) Okra fries (yummy! and fun) Lamb boti kebab (bit dry, but good with the black daal) Black daal (solid, but unmemorable) Pau Bhaji (prob our least favorite - we did not finish it) Butter bhutta (corn) (reminds me of the street corn of Taiwan, and elote) Garlic naan Chili cheese toast Rose lassi, house chai  As always, the atmosphere is the best part about this place with such keen attention to detail with the decor. They only take reservations up to 5:45 for what is technically lunch. And we did also learn that refills on the house chai only goes until 5pm (which is an odd rule tbh). Really recommend trying Dishoom at least once!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sauces with the okra fries, House chai
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Okra fries
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Lassi

J2bL29ZcmqSudrvX2ZtUPg.text: Seriously one of my favorite restaurants I've ever been to! The decor is impeccable and it's such a lively atmosphere. You've got to try the Ruby Chicken - easily my favorite dish. It's very savory and creamy like a Tikka Masala but has a unique flavor that I couldn't quite place that gives it a very special taste. They also have a Dishoom IPA which comes from a microbrewery in the UK and is specially made for them and it is so, so crisp and satisfying. Love, love, love this place!

4dzXGlbnmPb1gsv4_MpOcQ.text: Went there based on the reviews. We were very impressed with service from the staff. The food quality was great and came so quickly after we ordered. We are probably going to go back before leaving Edinburgh.

Z2dYOgbJzXg5gSHbptOJ5A.text: Great bar including very professional capable and friendly bartenders as well as aged cocktails in little sealed jars.    The food was nothing short of amazing.   Easily the best Indian food I have ever had.  Easily.   I also appreciated that place was not kitschy with junk, but there were clues around you were in an Indian restaurant.   We waited about 1/2 hour in the line outside to get into the bar.  The whole time the staff was bringing us little hot drinks to make sure we were comfortable while we waited (was a bit cold).  Is was another 1/2 hour or 40 minutes to get sat, but the bar was very nice and we enjoyed the bartender quite a lot.  Well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interesting bar with aged cocktails
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Wow.  Amazing bar.   Long wait to get to food but sooo good.

OzDFZgbWF3GxeIu4KBjofw.text: Excellent food - outstanding service! Our servers, Matt and Isa were attentive and knowledgeable. Food was fresh and delicious.

CqxWvAogvF78nrWZ5VYAKw.text: Authentic, SPICY Indian and Parsi food! Hustle, bustle and heat of Mumbai! Fabulous cocktails - recommend the Kohinoor Fizz and the Nimbu pani. Roomali roti is to die for - as is the Salli Boti and Black Dal (makhani). Didn't love the chicken tikka roll, but the prawns koliwada and crispy fried okra more than made up for it!

bL_P2mcU3po-ZP1tQFXzXA.text: When researching for my trip to the UK I came across this restaurant. We started our trip off in London where I attempted to get a table, but we weren't interested in waiting two hours to be seated. Before we got to Edinburgh I made a reservation for this location as I didn't want to miss out. Because there was so much hype around this restaurant I was afraid it would disappoint, but luckily it did not! All the food we received was truly delicious. The black Daal being my favorite item. I'm already looking forward to their cookbook coming out in the next couple of months. If heading to Edinburgh, do yourself a favor and make a reservation at Dishoom. You won't regret it!

ZGXtLEwnsuw8wSJIXNnr9A.text: Great food in the heart of Edinburgh. The place is huge and Staff very friendly. They take allergies seriously. Lots of food, half portions are enough (I eat a lot). Loved the Australian waitress in the downstairs bar!!

cUUKO0GPu3cI9mbHYhKH2Q.text: Dishoom came highly recommended from friends in the states. Walked in with six for breakfast at 10am with no wait and we were greeted by bottomless chai and I would go back for that!  Bottomless porridge Bacon naan roll Fire toast  Everything was amazing. Our waiter was delightfully and kept our botomeless chai full the entire time.   Located on St. Andrew's square, it was convenient and a lot to look at nearby before and after.  Highly recommend! We tried to go back for our last night when we were back in Edinburgh, but they were fully booked.

_qlUzBBDPxxqQF9qW9hV8w.text: Best place in Edinburgh for breakfast with a difference  If you like a bit of spice with your breakfast try the chicken livers

bhkfHLzpGdl6TUgjj1bAkA.text: Great food. Best dish : prawn koliwada. Murgh malai delicious; chicken tikka different because of vinegar but good nonetheless. Mutton chop good. Biryanis great both jackfruit and chicken one. Only the pav bhaji was a downer (as a pakka Mumbai kar can say nowhere close). Super service. All in all great Indian restaurant in Edinburgh.

ZgbXFv1XIGzo67fQiuhMDg.text: Came here on the recommendation of a local--great advice! Had the chicken tikki and the Mahi tikki along with the garlic naan, green vegetable bowl and cucumber salad bowl. Everything had a lot of flavor.  The menu had a lot of choices, from fish to chicken to lamb and more.  The service was crisp and attentive. I highly recommend trying this place!

a_4OzE50GZdxGZr8WzVxMw.text: Lovely restaurant. Like many other reviewers, we tried to go to the one of the London locations, but the line was too long. Fortunately we were able to get a table at the Edinburgh location. This restaurant does not disappoint. We were seated immediately when we arrived a bit after 5:00. The host was very friendly, as was our server. The establishment is quite large with both a basement seating area, a few bar seats in the ground floor, and an upstairs dining room, where we sat. The upstairs level has a gorgeous view of St. Andrew Square. I started the meal with a lovely glass of Spumante and some okra fries and fried prawns with various chutneys, which were delicious, though somewhat spicy, so be aware of that. For the main course I ordered the chicken tikka with jasmine rice and a side of broccoli with green beans and kale. The chicken was delicious., and the vegetables were wonderful; I've actually never had vegetables with Indian spices like that before and found that it really works. By the time we left, which was around 6:30, the place had started to fill up, but there was still no line st the door (in contrast to the Covent Garden location in London, where there was a serious line out the door around 9:00 pm). Very happy I got a chance to try Dishoom.

onk5P_pWpFCc-ecsMBS9fQ.text: Absolutely amazing food!!! The place was packed when we arrived and yet the service was extremely fast and our waitress was very helpful. Some of the best Indian food I have ever had I would high recommend to anyone in the area looking for marvelous meal experience

w33yvpKx8gJyM6V-092J7g.text: The best restaurant experience I've ever had!!! We tried to get into the London one but the wait was over two hours.  So when the one in Edinburgh was only 1:15 hours we decided to wait it out.  And it was definitely worth it.  In fact we cane back the next night and waited again.   The staff here is incredible and if you're waiting outside will give you some warm tea.  While waiting inside at the bar they will get your drink order and transfer the tab to you dinner which is wonderful.   For the food if you go with a group definitely try to share and get a taste of the different dishes.  My first night I had the Chicken Ruby - similar to chicken tikka masala.  The chicken was so tender and the sauce very taste and spiced perfectly.  If you did want it hotter they had a chili sauce on the table to add some heat.  The second night I got the. Chili chicken (technically a small plate) nd added rice.  It was good as well. Also I tasted the sheekh kabob and chef special salli boti and both great. I never tasted anything there I didn't like.   As for the service.  That is freaking amazing.  The first night everyone was wonder and very attentive. The second night in line we were recognized as being the the previous night and everyone who talked to us acknowledged us being there again. Then our waiter (a different server from the previous night) told us what we had the night before and recommend different things so we could get the full experience.  However they stored that information is incredible because we never have a surname. You must go but be prepared for a wait in line.

8hbHz9IqjpHPGKvl8j9Tww.text: Dishoom please open your restaurant in the US. I can simply put it this way, the food at Dishoom is as good as it can ever get!  Of my 4days in Edinburgh, I went to Dishoom 3 times. Almost daily :P  Everything about this place is a full full 5 star. The service, the food, the ambience. The ambience is so full of life, I went for breakfast, a late lunch and dinner, so you see I saw all the seasons before I am making the statement :). The waiters know all about the menu and help you if you have any questions. If you are going for dinner after 7pm it is better to book a table in advance. The wait maybe really long!   Here are my Dishoom favorites - chole puri, pau bhaji ( just like those street chaat vendors) house black dal ( creamy, and most comforting ) the house chai ( its bottomless, you can't just have one glass), okra fries, vada pau, malai kulfi, kejriwal and naan egg roll ( breakfast menu)  We were a large party for the dinner trip to Dishoom and here are some of the favorites from my non veggie members -lamb chops, sheekh kabab and all the varieties of naan.  The decor definitely took me back to my days in Bombay in those Parsi cafes. Especially during breakfast time I could see so many people ordering their dish and a chai and spending some alone time!   There is nothing about this restaurant that deserves anything less than 5 stars. If you are in UK and love Indian food please make a reservation and go here.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. House chai.

ZwOUJFa0L5U1kQMQDgX_JA.text: I'm gonna miss this place once we head back stateside and have to settle for good to even very good Indian food, because this place is just phenomenal. The reviews do it justice. It's a lively restaurant with the kitchen slinging out tasty fresh dishes lightning fast. Also the prices are somehow absurdly reasonable, offering an additional incentive to visit if tasty Indian food isn't enough on its own. It's the kind of place where you share everything and can order anything.   Definitely go for an order or two of the ruby chicken, which is similar to butter chicken but more savory than sweet, the chicken biryani has some lovely grill flavor to it as does the side of corn which is seasoned beautifully, the samosas each have a perfect pastry-to-filling ratio and aren't oily at all, the garlic naan is crispy like a flatbread but also somehow has some lovely fluffiness to it.   Oh and maybe most importantly, the meals are actually spicy! For an American who always orders Indian food spicy and it is still quite bland, this place does it effortlessly and consistently for every dish, without you needing to request it. Such a refreshing change of pace.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Ruby

ItVnZWZL0pTbLYOA3nhaXA.text: You already know this is an amazing restaurant but if it's your first time, what should you order?   We had lunch & breakfast here (on two separate days) and the following are some highlights about the dishes we tried...  Lunch  1. PAU BHAJI (4.5) - this dish was just like how my husbands grandmother (who lived in pre-colonial India) made it. From the flavour to the texture it was exactly how he remembered it. Personally, I prefer my potatoes a little chunky but I appreciated the smooth texture & the warm buttered buns complimented the dish very well.   2. SALLI BOTI (5/5)- tender lamb in an onion, tomato, spicy curry/salan with salli (thin potato crisps) on top. Full of both familiar & distinct flavors, this dish was incredible. A half order was perfect for two. Served with the perfect amount of naan.  3. MURGH MALAI (5/5) - perfect. Tender, nice charred bits on the edges, juicy, flavorful. Not spicy but this dish is not meant to be.   4. Chocolate pudding with chili ice cream - (4/5) - the chocolate was rich and delicious. The ice cream had a mild kick of chili at the end. Overall, a fun combination.   Breakfast  1. CHAI - if you're going to enjoy a South Asian breakfast, chai is a must.   2. AKURI (4/5) - the roasted tomato & warm buttery buns were a nice addition to this egg dish. The scrambled eggs were good, authentic to the time period they were replicating but not our favorite style.   3. EGG NAAN ROLL (4.5/5) - delicious fluffy/crispy naan & a perfect runny yolk. This was delicious. I wish there was more tomato chili jam evenly spread throughout the naan. Overall, very satisfying and the chutney was fantastic.  4. VEGAN SAUSAGE(4/5) - your standard vegan sausage with very mild spices. Was a good addition to our meal (I added mine into the egg naan roll)   You don't typically come across a huge range of breakfast items at South Asian restaurants so the variety in the menu was refreshing.   Heard great things about the Ruby Chicken, Lamb Shoulder & okra fries and will have to try those next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Vegan Sausage (4/5)
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Murgh Malai

4X6An67nbHl4XuC4YWGrAQ.text: We wanted to visit dishoom in London but our schedule didn't allow us to.We made it to dishoom edinburgh for Lunch on the day we arrived in edinburgh.The food is very very tasty and reminded me of Parsi cafes in Bombay.The decor is very similar to that cafes.Service was good. Bombay chilli chicken,salli pao are my favorites.

n0KEVf-Z9nK-EJAuVIBsfw.text: Extraordinary is what comes to mind when I think about food here.  Their pav bhaji - the best I have had Their vada pav - the best my husband had had Their Chole poori - the best I have had Their chutneys - awesome The chai - not how I like it, but pretty food  Loved the decor, the ambience, everything. Wish they had a branch in the US.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

zb29kG2QbpA1xj50Vb8zKQ.text: DELICIOUS! I had breakfast here and it was amazing. Food was incredible, service was good, and the view is gorgeous. The atmosphere was fun and I enjoyed the bottomless chai. A great spot for any meal but especially for a unique and yummy breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Breakfast featuring bacon naan roll and glass of chai.

ISWhn3YiTsvSE43qX5WpJQ.text: Oh, Dishoom.  It's renowned for a good reason. The food is delectable, the drinks are all good, the service is precise, the ambiance is wonderful. Transplanted here from the ever-popular London locations, Dishoom Edinburgh has all the quality of London with the prospect of a semi-reasonable wait. You should still expect to wait about 30 min, especially for dinner, but getting an amazing cocktail in the downstairs bar, "The Permit Room," is part of the process.   You really can't go wrong here.. but let me point out some favorites to steer you well. The Edinburgh house special (this location only) is Salli Boti - an amazing and rich dish showcasing Scottish lamb and served with gravy, crispy bits, and a very delicate roti. Other notables for me are the Pau Bhaji, Mattar Paneer, and Chole Puri. All delicious. For dessert, I quite like their Gulab Jamun! I would stay clear of the Kala Ice though... it's weird.   They also have a separate breakfast menu which looks fantastic and a breakfast loyalty program (several visits - a free Roti wrap). Anyway, it's a great place, perfect for a nicer dinner or special occasion, and I highly recommend a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Scrambled egg Akuri
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dishoom breakfast double bacon roll.
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Keema Per Eedu breakfast bowl!

UnqmIzYyUx1CJ0KV1hnlvw.text: Like many a lady, I headed to Edinburgh to experience an Outlander Tour. After the big let down that I didn't meet my own Jaime Fraser in the journey, it was time for dinner.   Dishoom had a fun atmosphere, convenient location (a 2 minute walk from the train), and given I was a solo dinner they sat me right away on a Friday night.   I appreciated the menu identifying vegan items, and the waiter explaining which things were more tasty made vegetarian (bring on the butter baby!). I would've tried more dishes, but a solo vacation often prohibits that.   I will be heading back next time I'm in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chai
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Samosas
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Menu

zrV1TFxnDiu-zqrbMRwuTA.text: SIMPLY WONDERFUL!!!  I was visiting Edinburgh for 4 nights and ended up dining here 2x--once for breakfast and once for dinner. Both visits were eye-opening experiences, but I would have to say there's a lot more value with breakfast--mainly bc of the 'bottomless' house chai (holy!!!) and bacon naan roll (cow!!!). We also got the bottomless date & banana porridge but it wasn't as special as the other two.   For dinner, we got the Chicken Ruby, Mahi Tikka, House Black Daal, Garlic Naan, Dishoom IPA, and House Chai. Phenomenal flavors for the Chicken Ruby, House Black Daal, and Garlic Naan.   It was an absolute pleasure dining at Dishoom's 5th and newest location. Definitely a MUST TRY if you're ever in Edinburgh (or London, 4 locations). Thank you for, hands down, the most exquisite Indian meal in my life! Cheers!

E1PzrFj7VQCwGDoA0w71LQ.text: This meal was so much fun. (Thank you, Yelpers!). It was definitely one of those spots I wouldn't have discovered otherwise. Apparently this is Dishoom's fifth location with the other four being smashing hits in London. I'm grateful we were able to visit for an Indian breakfast and sample some of their most popular dishes whilst soaking in the views of Andrew's Square and the park.   For starters, the interior is beautiful (don't miss the bathrooms on the lower level). We chose to soak in the sunshine on the front patio since the weather was so nice. My order consisted of the breakfast lassi with mangos, bananas and granola, the bacon naan, masala beans and bottomless chai. I especially enjoyed the lassi, beans and chai. Despite the bacon naan being one of their most popular items, it wasn't one of my favorites. The chai was delightful and the lassi was both refreshing and not too sweet. I'd love to visit again experience their other menus. Highly recommend for a colorful and flavor-packed meal.

mCIgmfgS4jv-bLg-zCMiNw.text: I came with a group of ladies for a reunion. We were waited in very attentively and the menu was explained to us how it worked.... we were a big group of about 10 and they handled us very well.  Food was amazing with different Indian choices than you would get at a usual Indian restaurant... roti bread was delicious and soft. We were advised so that we didn't over order as they knew how big the portions would be.... what's more as a lovely treat the head server gave us our first drinks free ?? Which was very generous... I would recommend the Bollywood Bellenis they were delicious... would definitely go back there ....

oPuc8OM7KxyOpTOxBUszbw.text: The food here is good, but the service and experience is unreal out of control on point. The cocktails are also superb, although they use low grade liquor which is a bit of a bummer if you're looking for a simple, nice gin or other spirit.   We were able to walk in on a week night - I believe it was a Tuesday - and this place was popping. They gave us a pager and sent us to the bar below the restaurant which was also buzzing. We shut the place down (which we did at most places in Scotland) so if you're looking for a nice long meal, this is the place to do it but come earlier than 8pm.   The staff was incredible and I felt well taken care of here. The atmosphere was rich and the food delicious. We ordered way too much, but everything was worth trying a bit of. I would come here for every special meal if I could, or even just a in night out with friends.   Ahh Dishoom. How I love you.

UbWfp_854VeEFjIjosriEQ.text: Really good Indian food in Edinburgh. The mango lassi is definitely worth getting and there is no wrong way to go with ordering, as all the dishes we ordered were amazing. Dishoom has a pretty upscale feel and the space is beautiful and enormous, boasting multiple floors and great views. The dishes are pretty filling but you may need to order more than you think you need, because the portions of the dishes are on the smaller side (almost tapas like).

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Dinner at Dishoom!

bvIrljVc3X_vMJ3qxK4nAg.text: I cannot give anything less than 5 stars. They have the best Indian food I have ever eaten. We were 11 friends from US touring UK. We booked our visit a month in advance.  They had made a special menu for us which had their most recommended entrees. Ordering was easy. Food and service were beyond my imagination. The wait and higher prices are all worth it and you walk out very satisfied. Thanks to my daughter who suggested this place. I am looking forward to my next visit.

Qp07f2SIC1JZaE9dnCeoGA.text: I've been meaning to try Dishoom, and I'm glad I did.  I got a lamb special (sorry, don't remember what it's called! Picture attached), chai and gulab jamun. Main dish is so flavorful, the spices were so layered and complex. Chai was fragrant and comforting. Gulab jamun is slightly sweet, but quite refreshing against the warm chai and spiced food.  Service was impeccable. Not too overbearing, and super friendly. They gave good recommendations on dessert, and refilled my chai accordingly. I'm a fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

-srgmqcNQU3l1rjU3sle6Q.text: A+ for the food, A++ for the awesome service our waiter provided!! First, he went through the menu to explain the different options to us since it was our first time there. He was enthusiastic, passionate about the food they served. He even let us sample a couple of things we had never had before without any prompting. He recommended some things based on what we told him we liked. We are so glad he did, our food was delicious! I went with the Ruby Chicken, we also had the Chef's special, cheese Naan, hot chai, and Dahl. We give two thumbs up!

E5FGe5suqMewCTzAH_T5Yg.text: We couldn't find a spot at any of the 4 branches in London so when we arrived in Edinburgh and opened yelp for a lunch spot , we were pleasantly surprised to see that they have a branch here too.  What sets this place apart is the ambience, the staff, the service and the quality of food.  Our server Abdul was extremely knowledgeable and gave great recommendations.  We ordered   Ruby chicken  Sallu boti Biryani  Malai chicken Potatoes  Kaali daal  Out of all the dishes , Ruby chicken , malai boti and the potatoes were out of this world while all the other dishes were great as well.  For drinks the kala katha and chocolate chai were a great twist to the usual and are a must try.  We loved it enough to book us back for brunch :)  If in Edinburgh and if a fan of Indian cuisine - this place is a must try !!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

HqAvX7bMEB2t9Dh8td0yVA.text: EDINBURGH HAS A DISHOOM! I REPEAT! EDINBURGH! DISHOOM!   When Chuck and I were in London, I forced us to eat at Dishoom. We loved the cocktails and food so much we visited another location for a second meal within a week. We were in Edinburgh to find a venue for our wedding. Our wedding planner suggested this great spot for breakfast over in New Town. "It is called Dishoom, have you heard of it?" We instantly made heart eyes at each other, made a note to find it and eat it asap.   We arrived around 630pm expecting a wait. Thankfully, we were brought right in and got a table immediately. Our server was incredibly nice and suggested a few cocktails. I ordered the Tehmuls Tangle while chuck got the old fashioned house cocktail. Both were delicious. We knew that we wanted to share so we grabbed two appetizers, chili chicken and chili cheese toast, an order of chicken ruby, rice and two garlic naan. Everything was delightful! The heat on the chicken appetizer was mildly hot. The ruby was also spicy but not very strong (especially after the chili chicken). The garlic naan, as always, was amazing to scoop up the sauces. After all that food, we got the dessert cocktails. One was an espresso martini and the other was a chai tea ice cream covered in liquors. The staff there were all so kind. Everyone from the serving manager (SO FRIENDLY) to the bar guys dropping the cocktails (actively interested in what we liked about our cocktails). By the time we left an hour and a half later, there was a waitlist building. If it is anything like the london branches, there will be a 2 hour wait shortly after and for good reason.  Next time we are definitely coming for breakfast, which sounds amazing, and another dinner or three. COME TO NYC, DISHOOM! You'd make a fortune off of me alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tehmuls tangle.
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chicken Ruby with rice and garlic naan.
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Chili chicken and chili cheese toast.

M0j5fIMHGyRzldBI8jyrzQ.text: Where to begin. My bf and I were planning a trip throughout the UK when a friend highly recommended we try Dishoom while in London, our first stop. However, on the night we decided to go, there was a 2 hour wait.  So needless to say we left slightly heartbroken--ahem *stomachbroken.   Cut to our second stop, Edinburgh, Scotland. On day 2, we were browsing restaurants on Yelp when Dishoom popped up!!! We had no idea it was here!  Score.   We popped in for a late lunch, and were seated right away. The server, Richard, was insanely helpful in walking us through the menu. He also suggested the Viceroy old fashioned served in a peg (pictured below) and aged. To. Perfection.   As far as the food--wow! Everything was as colorful and beautiful as it was amazing, with just the right amount of spice and complexity.   Highly recommend this place if you're in London (or Edinburgh!).

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

q40PL_WVvHpLzQ8Wi0tdPA.text: Went here multiple times over the course of my time in Scotland and the quality was always consistently great!  One of the best Indian restaurants I've been too.  Great chai, great daal, great chole bhatura...everything we tried here was amazing

HsIThi6tc-JST7NwcJafTw.text: Everything about this restaurant is amazing: costumer service, ambience, foods, and drinks. Dieogo was great  we ordered a ruby chicken (amazeballs and my fav), chicken tikka, matter paneer- all excellent!!!!  Favorite Cocktail: east india gimlet

Ui4ZATgb7sjhqa7WsEuHSQ.text: The food here was amazing! And the service was just as good. Went on my birthday and I was catered to very well. Their curry was rich in flavor and the naan was just as good. Highly recommend going here!

WCRrHq44bLaz_k_bO0Tyng.text: We were happily surprised to find a Dishoom outside London!  Made a brunch booking for Sunday and we were seated right away in the upstairs dining room.  I got a chai (bottomless) and a bacon egg naan roll.  The naan roll was absolutely delicious.  I am pregnant thus not drinking, but I can tell the naan roll would make the perfect hangover breakfast.  The egg was runny, the bread was crisp, and the sweet chutney dipping sauce was delicious.  Hard to imagine how I'd want to order anything else for breakfast at Dishoom again.  I found the chai a little average for something so hyped, and they were fairly slow bringing it in the first place (food came before my chai or my husband's coffee) and bringing refills, and the bill, but I was so happily full of bacon and egg naan roll I didn't even care.  I find their brunch prices to be a real bargain as well - you get stuffed on gourmet spicy deliciousness for not much money.

SjwWVJgiW1yKW66h6Qw5OA.text: Amazing waiter, unbelievable food (especially considering the price). Really recommend the pau bhaji, everyone went crazy for it.

H2Im-S3Sh2eBXN5F3EaWIg.text: The food was more Indian than Iranian as advertised. Somewhat to the spicy side for my taste. The place was packed even on a Tuesday night. They had awesome music in the background apparently a remix CD they have for their two restaurants. Friendly service. Nice ambience. Great place for group of about 5-6.  Like I said slightly spicy but delicious.
